title.narrative: GENERATE, ANALYZE, USE AND DISSEMINATE DATA AND KNOWLEDGE

description.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity to deliver integrated social protection services, including goods and cash, to the most deprived families, as well as in support of families, including children on the move, during acute emergency and recovery, in line with the CCCs., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child rights and gender equality prioritized in evidence-based public discourse, national policies, budget allocations, legislation, and social protection systems and progressively promoted and protected in social and cultural attitudes, practices and norms, with a focus on the most vulnerable

participating-org.narrative: THE OXFORD POVERTY AND HUMAN DEVELO OPHI

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity to deliver integrated social protection services,including goods and cash, to the most deprived families, as well as in support of families, including children on the move, duringacute emergency and recovery, in line with the CCCs.

description.narrative: The 2019-2020 Income, Expenditure and Labour Force survey final report was officially released during the first quarter of 2021 providing updated data to 21 SDG indicators. The 2021 UNICEF completed situation analysis for the period 2015-2021 in preparation for the development of a new country programme.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
